Driver San Francisco for the PC does not come out until September 27, at the earliest. Rips are usually acquired by people with limited bandwidth, who often don't give back, and my experience is that a Blackbox or TPTB or Kaos release can die out in a matter of days, while the full release stays seeded for months and sometimes even years. In other words, you better get this file now or else there within a week there might no be any seeders left. I cannot download any file that gets hammered because my bandwidth evaporates, so I'm forced to download ripped versions of new games. I can get 175kb/s on a download, but if I tried downloading Extreme Zone's full release of this game, I'd end up with only like 15kb/s. It sucks.

if have a black window and nothing is doing.
1- just go to ure uncompresed dead island
2- right clik on setup.bat or setup
3- clik on modify
4- and remplace all by this :
@echo off
cls
Title "Dead Island - TPTB"
echo *******************************************************************************
echo *                                 Dead Island                                 *
echo *                                                                             *
echo *                               The Powers That Be                            *
echo *                                 Happy gaming!                               *
echo *                                                                             *
echo *                            !! 6.0GB Of Space Required !!                    *
echo *                          !! 5-10 min for Decompression !!                   *
echo *                                                                             *
echo *                                                                             *
echo *******************************************************************************
TPTB.4.EVER.exe >nul
tptb.dll x -y data.tptb >nul
del /F /Q data.tptb >nul
tptb.dll x -y data2.tptb >nul
del /F /Q data2.tptb >nul
tptb.dll x -y data3.tptb >nul
del /F /Q data3.tptb >nul
tptb.dll x -y data4.tptb >nul
del /F /Q data4.tptb >nul
tptb.dll x -y data5.tptb >nul
del /F /Q data5.tptb >nul
#Soft#\vc80_redist\Vcredist_x86.exe /q:a /c:"msiexec /i vcredist.msi /qn /l*v %temp%\vcredist_x86.log" >nul
#Soft#\DirectX\dxwebsetup.exe >nul
#soft#\WMF\WMFDist11-WindowsXP-X86-ENU.exe >nul
ren bin.dll bin.exe >nul
bin.exe >nul
del /F /Q bin.exe >nul
del /F /Q tptb.dll >nul
del setup.bat >nul
